gameDetails.matchup: Memphis Grizzlies vs New Orleans Pelicans
gameDetails.venue: Smoothie King Center, New Orleans, LA

recentPerformance.hitRate: Home dogs covering well this season

keyFactors.title: Home Court Advantage
keyFactors.description: Pelicans at Smoothie King Center where they've been competitive. Home crowd provides energy boost, especially in close games.

keyFactors.title: Zion Williamson Factor
keyFactors.description: When healthy, Zion provides dominant interior presence. His ability to finish at the rim and draw fouls keeps Pelicans in games.

keyFactors.title: Grizzlies Road Struggles
keyFactors.description: Memphis has been inconsistent on the road. Young team can be prone to lapses in focus in hostile environments.

keyFactors.title: 3.5 Points Too Many
keyFactors.description: For a home team with talent, getting nearly a full possession felt like value. Expected a competitive game.

riskFactors: Pelicans dealing with multiple injuries throughout roster
Memphis has Jaren Jackson Jr. playing at All-NBA level
Zach Edey's size creates matchup problems
Ja Morant's explosiveness can take over games

joseAlvarado.note: Career-type performance, especially in first half with 18 points

zionWilliamson.note: Hit miraculous scoop shot with 0.9 seconds to force OT

quarterBreakdown.description: Pelicans started hot. Jose Alvarado caught fire from deep. Built early momentum at home.
Alvarado continued his explosion with 18 first-half points. Pelicans built commanding 68-53 lead at halftime.
DISASTER. Grizzlies came out of halftime with 13-2 run. Memphis completely flipped the script with intensity and defense.
Back and forth battle. Pelicans clawed back. Zion hit heroic driving scoop with 0.9 seconds left to tie at 122 and force OT.
Memphis dominated extra period 11-6. Zach Edey took over. Pelicans ran out of gas after regulation effort.

gameResults.gamePace: High-scoring affair with 261 total points. Both teams pushed tempo.
gameResults.edeyDominance: Grizzlies were +39 during Zach Edey's 35 minutes on court. His presence was game-changing.

whatWentWrong.title: Third Quarter Collapse
whatWentWrong.description: Led by 15 at halftime, then allowed 13-2 run to start the third. Complete defensive breakdown let Memphis back in.

whatWentWrong.title: Overtime Fatigue
whatWentWrong.description: After fighting back to force OT, Pelicans had nothing left. Outscored 11-6 in extra period.

whatWentWrong.title: Zach Edey Matchup Nightmare
whatWentWrong.description: No answer for Edey's size. His +39 on/off differential was staggering. Grizzlies dominated with him on the floor.

statisticalContext.marginOfCover: Missed spread by 1.5 points (lost by 5, needed +3.5)
statisticalContext.overtimeImpact: OT losses are brutal for spread bettors - the extra period killed us

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Brutal variance. Right read on the game being competitive. Led by 15, forced OT on heroic shot, but couldn't close. Lost by 5 in OT, missing cover by 1.5 points. Sometimes you do everything right and still lose.

closingLineValue.verdict: Line held steady. Market agreed this was a fair price. No edge lost or gained on line movement.

keyTakeaways: OT games are variance nightmares for spread bettors
Would have covered in regulation - lost specifically because of overtime
Led by 15 at halftime - initial read was correct
Zion's heroic shot forced OT but couldn't finish in extra period
Zach Edey's dominance (+39 on/off) was the difference maker
Third quarter collapses after big halftime leads are brutal
Sometimes the right side loses - that's variance
verdict: Right side, wrong result. Led by 15, forced OT on Zion heroics, lost in extra period by 1.5 points more than the spread. Variance loss, not process failure.
